content:
Some ValueSets are expanded in the IG, whereas others are not.
I can't figure out the rule.
It is important to see the expansion because codes that the terminology server doesn't recognize (e.g., snomed codes that haven't yet been published in US SNOMED) are not included in the expansion.

Expanded: 

- http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-mCODE-ig/branches/finalize-tg263/ValueSet-mcode-radiotherapy-volume-type-vs.html (small)

- http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-mCODE-ig/branches/finalize-tg263/ValueSet-mcode-radiotherapy-technique-vs.html (16 codes)
- http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-mCODE-ig/branches/finalize-tg263/ValueSet-mcode-radiotherapy-treatment-location-qualifier-vs.html (10s)
- http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-mCODE-ig/branches/finalize-tg263/ValueSet-mcode-secondary-cancer-disorder-vs.html. (100s of codes)

Not Expanded ("Not supported by Publication Tooling"): 

- http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-mCODE-ig/branches/finalize-tg263/ValueSet-mcode-radiotherapy-treatment-location-vs.html. (~350 codes)

Is the last one a bug?
That last one is expanded in the guide on build.fhir.org: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-mCODE-ig/ValueSet-mcode-radiotherapy-treatment-location-vs.html
well, it's not really a bug. did you look to see what qa.html says about that value set? because it's quite a bit

I used to reflect the error from the terminology subsystem into the page, but people complained because the users complained about it. So against my better judgement, I was persuaded to suppress the error into qa.html and replace it with a generic 'not supported', irrespective of the actual issue
Saul Kravitz has marked this topic as resolved.
